intro: Crepis swynnertonii, commonly known as Swynnerton's hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It produces achenes with pappus hairs, which aid in wind dispersal. Crepis swynnertonii is a relatively small plant, usually reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
